Limit your chests. It might be that you're making too many stacks of things too quickly and therefore make a lot of pollution.

At this current stage of the game, you probably don't need 500 miners in a box, or 8000 ammo mags.

Eventually, you'll have more than enough production so that constant attacks aren't a problem. At that stage, produce whatever you want and ignore the pollution :)

But I would recommend to relocate the biters away from your cloud. Build Walls on keypoints that are easy to defend. On the long hang your factory (and so the pollution) will grow anyway.

Press "P" and check you pollution "production". Typically miners produce the most pollution, i recommend efficiency 1 modules in all your miners. It'll greatly reduce pollution and electricity consumption which in turn reduced pollution from boilers.

If you have that, eff1 in the assemblers that always run may also help reduce the cloud further.

I never used eff2 or eff3 as the extra value isn't worth it to me.

the only way in vanilla to reduce your cloud is to halt production of pollution and use pollution free solar for power. so shut down your science labs for awhile, or just finish the next tech and stop your rocket launches if you have them going. once your consumption of science ends the productions will back up. once they back up all the way to the miners everything will halt. ensure your defensive line and artillery are set and let the game run for awhile. the cloud will die down over time as nothing will produce pollution if not running and solar will easily handle the constant drain of sleeping machines.

To reduce your cloud make sure to:

convert all miners from Burner miner -> electric miner -> electric miner with eff 1

Convert all furnaces to steel furnace, then to electric furnace with eff 1

For any burner fuel you do use, light oil solid fuel is better than coal.

Upgrading your assembly machines to the highest tier available and adding efficiency 1 helps.

Placing eff 1 in refineries / Chem plants helps as well.

For power, this is the last thing to do from a cost / pollution saved perspective, nuclear will be the best choice as itâ€™s about 10x cheaper per MW than solar, but if you donâ€™t have uranium go ahead and get a solar / accum grid going.

If you do all of this youâ€™ll either have a smaller pollution cloud with the same production or youâ€™ll have the same pollution cloud with something like 10-20x production

Efficiency mods in drills, then furnaces. Those machines create mist of the pollution.

Prod mods in the purple and yellow science factories. 25% less input means 25% less pollution.

Make a ring of laser turrets on coal power. Put everything else on solar. You don't need to produce all night.

Michael Hendrick's No Spoon guide and videos go to extremes. Default settings, and only 1 set of boilers. He clears a wide ring early, a d the pollution cloud barely grows.

Tier 1 efficiency chips in miners helps a lot. Not only do they cut energy usage, but they cut pollution usage by the same amount. 3 Tier 1 Efficiency chip in a miner means that it now outputs only 20% of the pollution, and consumes only 20% of the power without chips. It's a pretty effective strategy for newer players.

Eventually you'll be faster and more efficient in putting up defenses and the like, and you won't need them when you have better defensive options, but they are fairly useful in the early to midgame.

Pressing the P button opens graphs, there is a pollution tab there, so you can check what type of building produces the most pollution. Two most contributing will be drills and boilers probably.

Add accumulators so steam won't have to kick in at all. Get more effective with clearing nests. It should be possible to have no nests and no attacks at all. Effective nests killing works like this: if you have spidertrons, no problem, set a group armed with yellow rockets around, you can do it with one remote if they all set to follow one, so you don't need to be present at all.

If you don't have spidertrons, it requires you. Wear mk2 power armor with shield, reactor, 2 mk2 batteries, 3 legs, 5-6 personal laser defense, dodge spits, cover a nest with gas grenades.

If you don't have mk2, use tank with rocket fuel, power armor with roboport and repair kits, circle around the nest, be sure not to drive into a cliff, because stopping means death, cover the nest in gas, deploy 4-8 defender bots before you engage.

If you don't have a tank yet, it all you. Just run around throw grenades, don't walk into the cloud, deploy 4-8 defenders.
